techmeme.title: MicroStrategy says it didn't buy any bitcoin in the prior week, ending 12 consecutive weekly purchases worth $20B+ starting in October 2024, and holds ~$44.7B (Monique Mulima/Bloomberg)
The Beatles' Now and Then, created using AI and an original 1970s lo-fi demo, won Best Rock Performance at the Grammys; McCartney and Starr completed it in 2021 (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
French startup Riot, which educates staff about cybersecurity risks, raised a $30M Series B, a source says at a $170M+ valuation, and had $10M in 2024 revenue (Romain Dillet/TechCrunch)
Chainalysis and others estimate $Trump had generated $86M to $100M in trading fees by January 30; its market cap, which passed $14.5B on January 19, is down 66% (Reuters)
Sources: the European Commission and four member nations plan a probe into Shein over illegal products, opening the fast fashion marketplace to potential fines (Bloomberg)
